Record Class DoubleRange

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
io.github.ericmedvet.jnb.datastructure.DoubleRange
Record Components:
min - the lower bound of the interval
max - the upper bound of the interval
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public record DoubleRange(double min, double max) extends Record implements Serializable
An interval delimited by two bounds, min and max.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • UNIT

      public static final DoubleRange UNIT
      The interval $[0,1]$.

    • SYMMETRIC_UNIT

      public static final DoubleRange SYMMETRIC_UNIT
      The interval $[-1,1]$.

    • UNBOUNDED

      public static final DoubleRange UNBOUNDED
      The unbound interval $[-\infty,\infty]$.

  • Constructor Details

    • DoubleRange

      public DoubleRange(double min, double max)
      Default constructor.
      Parameters:
      min - the lower bound of the interval
      max - the upper bound of the interval
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if max is lower than min

  • Method Details

    • intersection

      public static DoubleRange intersection(List<DoubleRange> ranges)
      Builds an interval which has the highest lower bound across all the input intervals and the lowest upper bound across all the input intervals. The built interval is the intersection of all the input intervals, if not empty.
      Parameters:
      ranges - the input intervals
      Returns:
      the intersection of all the input intervals
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the intersection of ranges is empty

    • union

      public static DoubleRange union(List<DoubleRange> ranges)
      Builds an interval which has the lowest lower bound across all the input intervals and the highest upper bound across all the input intervals. The returned interval is the smallest interval that contains all the input intervals.
      Parameters:
      ranges - the input intervals
      Returns:
      the smallest interval that contains all the input intervals

    • center

      public double center()
      Returns the center of the interval, i.e., (min+max)/2.
      Returns:
      the center of the interval

    • clip

      public double clip(double value)
      Clips (i.e., clamps) the given value into this interval. Returns value if value >= min and value <= max, else min if value < min, else max.
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      the clipped value

    • contains

      public boolean contains(double value)
      Checks if the given value belongs to this interval (assuming both bound included).
      Parameters:
      value - the input value
      Returns:
      true if value belongs the interval, false otherwise

    • contains

      public boolean contains(DoubleRange other)
      Checks if the given other interval is contained in this interval. This holds if both other bounds are contained in this interval.
      Parameters:
      other - the other interval
      Returns:
      true if other is contained in this, false otherwise

    • delta

      public DoubleRange delta(double offset)
      Returns a new interval which is shifted by the given offset with respect to this interval. If this interval is $[a,b]$ and offset is $\delta$, then returns $[a+\delta,b+\delta]$.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset to shift
      Returns:
      another interval shifted by an offset

    • denormalize

      public double denormalize(double value)
      Denormalizes, by shifting and rescaling, the given normalized value to this interval. If this interval is $[a,b]$ and value is $v \in [0,1]$, then returns $a+v(b-a)$.
      Parameters:
      value - the normalized, i.e., in $[0,1]$ value
      Returns:
      the denormalized value

    • extend

      public DoubleRange extend(double r)
      Returns a new interval which is extended by a factor r with respect to this interval but with the same center. If this interval is $[a,b]$ and r is $r$, then returns $[\frac{a+b}{2}-\frac{r}{2}(b-a),\frac{a+b}{2}+\frac{r}{2}(b-a)]$.
      Parameters:
      r - the extent rescaling factor
      Returns:
      the extended interval

    • extent

      public double extent()
      Returns the extent of this interval. If this interval is $[a,b]$, then returns $b-a$.
      Returns:
      the extent

    • intersectionWith

      public DoubleRange intersectionWith(DoubleRange other)
      Returns an interval which has the highest lower bound of this and the other interval and the lowest upper bound of this and the other interval. The returned interval is the intersection of this and the other interval, if not empty. If this interval is $[a_1,b_2]$ and other is $[a_2,b_2]$, then returns $[\max(a_1,a_2),\min(b_1,b_2)]$.
      Parameters:
      other - the other interval
      Returns:
      the intersection of this and other
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the intersection of this and other is empty

    • normalize

      public double normalize(double value)
      Normalizes, by shifting and rescaling, the given value to this interval. If this interval is $[a,b]$ and value is $v \in [a,b]$, then returns $\frac{v-a}{b-a}$.
      Parameters:
      value - the value in this interval to be normalized
      Returns:
      the normalized value, i.e., a number in $[0,1]$

    • overlaps

      public boolean overlaps(DoubleRange other)
      Checks if this interval overlaps the other interval.
      Parameters:
      other - the other interval
      Returns:
      true if this overlaps other, false otherwise

    • points

      public DoubleStream points(int n)
      Returns the DoubleStream of the most widespread n equispaced values in this interval. Builds the DoubleStream through DoubleStream.iterate(double, DoublePredicate, DoubleUnaryOperator) applying an increment given by the extent of this interval divided by n and starting from the lower bound of this interval.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of points
      Returns:
      a stream of n equispaced points in this interval

    • unionWith

      public DoubleRange unionWith(DoubleRange other)
      Returns an interval which has the lowest lower bound of this and the other interval and the highest upper bound of this and the other interval. The returned interval is the smallest interval that contains both this and the other interval. If this interval is $[a_1,b_2]$ and other is $[a_2,b_2]$, then returns $[\min(a_1,a_2),\max(b_1,b_2)]$.
      Parameters:
      other - the other interval
      Returns:
      the smallest interval containing this and other

    • toString

      public final String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record class. The representation contains the name of the class, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      a string representation of this object

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this object. The value is derived from the hash code of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      hashCode in class Record
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.

    • min

      public double min()
      Returns the value of the min record component.
      Returns:
      the value of the min record component

    • max

      public double max()
      Returns the value of the max record component.
      Returns:
      the value of the max record component
